content.question: The derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals 5 times open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, times the sine of, open parenthesis, x squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. On the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which of the following values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a local minimum?

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
